de.iabg.mesh
Interface MeshConnectionWriter

All Known Implementing Classes:
ASCIIMeshConnectionWriter
public interface MeshConnectionWriter

This interface declares basic functionality for writing a file containing geometric connection data, namely node connections. In general, the user should call setFirstMeshFile(java.io.File) and setLastMeshFile(java.io.File) so that the file data can also be written. The data can then be written by calling exportNodeConnections(de.iabg.mesh.NodeConnectionMatrix).

Version:
September 14, 2008
Author:
Adam C. Dick, BSE

Method Summary

          Writes the given node connections.

          Internally saves the file data to be written with any exported data.

Method Detail

exportNodeConnections

void exportNodeConnections(NodeConnectionMatrix connections)
                           throws java.io.IOException
Writes the given node connections. This method should be called after setFirstMeshFile(java.io.File) and setLastMeshFile(java.io.File) so that the file data can also be written.

Parameters:
connections - the NodeConnectionMatrix to be written
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the file could not be written

setFirstMeshFile

void setFirstMeshFile(java.io.File firstMeshFile)
Internally saves the file data to be written with any exported data.

Parameters:
firstMeshFile - the file of the First Mesh

setLastMeshFile

void setLastMeshFile(java.io.File lastMeshFile)
Internally saves the file data to be written with any exported data.

Parameters:
lastMeshFile - the file of the Last Mesh
